reasoning: This is a comprehensive test coverage task requiring creation of multiple test files to cover all data types with this./global. keywords, modifier permutations, and context variations. While extensive, it follows existing test patterns in the codebase and requires no external integrations or infrastructure changes.

scope.notes: Test files only. Need ~11 data type tests for this., ~11 for global., nested scope error test, plus modifier permutation tests across 3 contexts (scope level, private method, public method). All tests follow existing .cnx test file pattern.

integrations.notes: No external integrations. Uses existing Jest test framework and .cnx/.expected.c test file pattern already established in the codebase.

infrastructure.notes: Pure test file additions. No infrastructure changes required.

knowledge.notes: Existing scope tests in tests/scope/ provide clear patterns. Data types documented in tests/primitives/all-types.cnx. Modifiers (atomic, clamped, wrapped, critical, registers) have existing tests in their respective directories.

concerns: May uncover existing bugs in scope implementation
Large number of tests could be tedious but not risky
risk.notes: Test code only - no production code changes. Tests may reveal bugs which is the intended purpose.

test_matrix_summary.notes: Full permutation testing may be impractical; likely need strategic coverage of key combinations

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Test files only with no production code changes. The tests themselves serve as validation - running npm test will verify the implementation compiles and transpiles correctly for all covered cases.
